net.wombatrpgs.rainfall.core
Class GameScreen

java.lang.Object
  net.wombatrpgs.rainfall.core.GameScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<GameScreen>, Renderable, CommandListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
TestScreen
public abstract class GameScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements CommandListener, java.lang.Comparable<GameScreen>, Renderable

A screen is the environment in which the game is now running. It's essentially part of a massive state machine that defines the game, and saves some notes about its parameters, such as the screen to display and how to handle keys. Screens can be layered one on top of the other. In this case, the screens with lower z values are rendered first, and the screens behind are only rendered if the screen on top of them is counted as transparent. More info in the ScreenStack class.

Constructor Detail

GameScreen

public GameScreen()
Creates a new game screen. Remember to call intialize when done setting things up yourself.

Method Detail

onFocusLost

public abstract void onFocusLost()
Called whenever this screen stops being the top screen on the stack. The screen will stop receiving player commands.

onFocusGained

public abstract void onFocusGained()
Called whenever this screen starts being the top screen on the stack. The screen will start receiving player commands.

setZ

public void setZ(float z)
Sets the z value (depth) of the screen. Higher z values are rendered later.

Parameters:
z - The new z-value

public float getZ()
Returns the z value (depth) of the screen. Higher z values are rendered later.

Returns:
The current z-value
